title: How to: SSH Tunnel with SSO password --> With SHARE SSH CONNECTION option
author: lars18th
body_snippet:
Hi,

I'm testing the last nightly build, and the "new" SSH TUNNEL (jump host) functionality is a must have. Thank you for it. However, I have one suggestion to improve it:

- The idea is to add a new option called "share tunnel password". This implements the functionality to store the typed password _the fisrt time it's used_. And for all new connections using the same tunnel, the password of the jump host will be reused... without typing it again. This will be similar to a SSO (Single Sign-...

iterations.description: Implement functionality to enable SSH tunneling with SSO password authentication when the 'Share SSH Connection' option is active.

comments.author: lars18th
comments.snippet:
Hi,

Good news! You can configure the PuTTY TUNNEL connection to achieve this! ðŸ˜œ 

To do it, configure in PuTTY the connection used for the tunnel with these options:
- Connection / SSH -->
  - [ON] Share SSH connections if possible.
  - [ON] Upstream
  - [ON] Downstream

Then when you open a new connection with the tunnel only _one time_ the password is requested. Futhermore, I suggest to enable also the option:
- Connection / SSH -->
  - [ON] Don't start a shell or command at all....

comments.author: lars18th
comments.snippet:
Hi,

One point: Using the SHARE SSH CONNECTION in the jump host connection, one drawback exists: when you close the _first_ connection, all others that share the connection will lost the connection. So, take note of it!

I suggest to improve this checking if more than one connection is in use, and then don't close the background tunnel connection.

Regards.
